Filter.description: The Q or Quality of the filter
Filter.name: Q

Filter.description:
The type of the filter. Types: "lowpass", "highpass",
"bandpass", "lowshelf", "highshelf", "notch", "allpass", or "peaking".
Filter.name: type

Filter.description:
The rolloff of the filter which is the drop in db
per octave. Implemented internally by cascading filters.
Only accepts the values -12, -24, -48 and -96.
Filter.name: rolloff

Filter.name: context

The amount of carryover between the current and last frame.
 Only applied meter for "level" type.

Meter.name: smoothing

Analyser.description: The size of analysis. This must be a power of two in the range 32 to 32768.
Analyser.name: size

Analyser.description: The analysis function returned by analyser.getValue(), either "fft" or "waveform".
Analyser.name: type

Analyser.description: 0 represents no time averaging with the last analysis frame.
Analyser.name: smoothing

Analyser.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Analyser.name: context

CrossFade.description: The mix between the two inputs. A fade value of 0 will output 100% input[0] and a value of 1 will output 100% input[1].
CrossFade.name: fade

CrossFade.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
CrossFade.name: context

Envelope.description:
When triggerAttack is called, the attack time is the amount of
 time it takes for the envelope to reach it's maximum value.
Envelope.name: attack

Envelope.description:
After the attack portion of the envelope, the value will fall
 over the duration of the decay time to it's sustain value.
Envelope.name: decay

Envelope.description:
The sustain value is the value
	which the envelope rests at after triggerAttack is
	called, but before triggerRelease is invoked.
Envelope.name: sustain

Envelope.description:
After triggerRelease is called, the envelope's
 value will fall to it's miminum value over the
 duration of the release time.
Envelope.name: release

Envelope.description:
Read the current value of the envelope. Useful for
syncronizing visual output to the envelope.
Envelope.name: value

Envelope.description:
The shape of the attack. Can be any of these strings:
  • linear
  • exponential
  • sine
  • cosine
  • bounce
  • ripple
  • step
Can also be an array which describes the curve. Values in the array are evenly subdivided and linearly interpolated over the duration of the attack.
Envelope.name: attackCurve

Envelope.description: The shape of the release. See the attack curve types.
Envelope.name: releaseCurve

Envelope.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Envelope.name: context

Follower.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Follower.name: context

FrequencyEnvelope.description:
The envelope's mininum output value. This is the value which it
starts at.
FrequencyEnvelope.name: baseFrequency

FrequencyEnvelope.description:
The number of octaves above the baseFrequency that the
envelope will scale to.
FrequencyEnvelope.name: octaves

FrequencyEnvelope.description:
When triggerAttack is called, the attack time is the amount of
 time it takes for the envelope to reach it's maximum value.
FrequencyEnvelope.name: attack

FrequencyEnvelope.description:
After the attack portion of the envelope, the value will fall
 over the duration of the decay time to it's sustain value.
FrequencyEnvelope.name: decay

FrequencyEnvelope.description:
The sustain value is the value
	which the envelope rests at after triggerAttack is
	called, but before triggerRelease is invoked.
FrequencyEnvelope.name: sustain

FrequencyEnvelope.description:
After triggerRelease is called, the envelope's
 value will fall to it's miminum value over the
 duration of the release time.
FrequencyEnvelope.name: release

FrequencyEnvelope.description:
Read the current value of the envelope. Useful for
syncronizing visual output to the envelope.
FrequencyEnvelope.name: value

FrequencyEnvelope.description:
The shape of the attack. Can be any of these strings:
  • linear
  • exponential
  • sine
  • cosine
  • bounce
  • ripple
  • step
Can also be an array which describes the curve. Values in the array are evenly subdivided and linearly interpolated over the duration of the attack.
FrequencyEnvelope.name: attackCurve

FrequencyEnvelope.description: The shape of the release. See the attack curve types.
FrequencyEnvelope.name: releaseCurve

FrequencyEnvelope.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
FrequencyEnvelope.name: context

LFO.description:
The amplitude of the LFO, which controls the output range between
the min and max output. For example if the min is -10 and the max
is 10, setting the amplitude to 0.5 would make the LFO modulate
between -5 and 5.
LFO.name: amplitude

LFO.description: The miniumum output of the LFO.
LFO.name: min

LFO.description: The maximum output of the LFO.
LFO.name: max

LFO.description: The type of the oscillator: sine, square, sawtooth, triangle.
LFO.name: type

LFO.description: The output units of the LFO.
LFO.name: units

LFO.description: Returns the playback state of the source, either "started" or "stopped".
LFO.name: state

LFO.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
LFO.name: context

MidSideMerge.description: The mid signal input. Alias for input[0]
MidSideMerge.name: mid

MidSideMerge.description: The side signal input. Alias for input[1]
MidSideMerge.name: side

MidSideMerge.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
MidSideMerge.name: context

MidSideSplit.description: The mid send. Connect to mid processing. Alias for output[0]
MidSideSplit.name: mid

MidSideSplit.description: The side output. Connect to side processing. Alias for output[1]
MidSideSplit.name: side

MidSideSplit.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
MidSideSplit.name: context

Panner.description: The pan control. -1 = hard left, 1 = hard right.
Panner.name: pan

Panner.description: The pan control. -1 = hard left, 1 = hard right.
Panner.name: pan

Panner.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Panner.name: context

Panner3D.description: The x position of the panner object.
Panner3D.name: positionX

Panner3D.description: The y position of the panner object.
Panner3D.name: positionY

Panner3D.description: The z position of the panner object.
Panner3D.name: positionZ

Panner3D.description: The x orientation of the panner object.
Panner3D.name: orientationX

Panner3D.description: The y orientation of the panner object.
Panner3D.name: orientationY

Panner3D.description: The z orientation of the panner object.
Panner3D.name: orientationZ

Panner3D.description: A reference distance for reducing volume as source move further from the listener
Panner3D.name: refDistance

Panner3D.description: Describes how quickly the volume is reduced as source moves away from listener.
Panner3D.name: rolloffFactor

Panner3D.description: The distance model used by,  "linear", "inverse", or "exponential".
Panner3D.name: distanceModel

Panner3D.description: The angle, in degrees, inside of which there will be no volume reduction
Panner3D.name: coneInnerAngle

Panner3D.description:
The angle, in degrees, outside of which the volume will be reduced
 to a constant value of coneOuterGain
Panner3D.name: coneOuterAngle

Panner3D.description: The gain outside of the coneOuterAngle
Panner3D.name: coneOuterGain

Panner3D.description:
The maximum distance between source and listener,
 after which the volume will not be reduced any further.
Panner3D.name: maxDistance

Panner3D.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Panner3D.name: context

ScaledEnvelope.description:
The envelope's min output value. This is the value which it
starts at.
ScaledEnvelope.name: min

ScaledEnvelope.description:
The envelope's max output value. In other words, the value
at the peak of the attack portion of the envelope.
ScaledEnvelope.name: max

ScaledEnvelope.description:
When triggerAttack is called, the attack time is the amount of
 time it takes for the envelope to reach it's maximum value.
ScaledEnvelope.name: attack

ScaledEnvelope.description:
After the attack portion of the envelope, the value will fall
 over the duration of the decay time to it's sustain value.
ScaledEnvelope.name: decay

ScaledEnvelope.description:
The sustain value is the value
	which the envelope rests at after triggerAttack is
	called, but before triggerRelease is invoked.
ScaledEnvelope.name: sustain

ScaledEnvelope.description:
After triggerRelease is called, the envelope's
 value will fall to it's miminum value over the
 duration of the release time.
ScaledEnvelope.name: release

ScaledEnvelope.description:
Read the current value of the envelope. Useful for
syncronizing visual output to the envelope.
ScaledEnvelope.name: value

ScaledEnvelope.description:
The shape of the attack. Can be any of these strings:
  • linear
  • exponential
  • sine
  • cosine
  • bounce
  • ripple
  • step
Can also be an array which describes the curve. Values in the array are evenly subdivided and linearly interpolated over the duration of the attack.
ScaledEnvelope.name: attackCurve

ScaledEnvelope.description: The shape of the release. See the attack curve types.
ScaledEnvelope.name: releaseCurve

ScaledEnvelope.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
ScaledEnvelope.name: context

Solo.description:
Isolates this instance and mutes all other instances of Tone.Solo.
 Only one instance can be soloed at a time. A soloed
 instance will report `solo=false` when another instance is soloed.
Solo.name: solo

Solo.description: If the current instance is muted, i.e. another instance is soloed
Solo.name: muted

Solo.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Solo.name: context

CtrlInterpolate.description:
The interpolated index between values. For example: a value of 1.5
 would interpolate equally between the value at index 1
 and the value at index 2.
CtrlInterpolate.name: index

CtrlInterpolate.description: The current interpolated value based on the index
CtrlInterpolate.name: value

CtrlMarkov.description:
The Markov values with states as the keys
 and next state(s) as the values.
CtrlMarkov.name: values

CtrlMarkov.description:
The current state of the Markov values. The next
 state will be evaluated and returned when Tone.CtrlMarkov.next
 is invoked.
CtrlMarkov.name: value

CtrlPattern.description: The array of values to arpeggiate over
CtrlPattern.name: values

CtrlPattern.description: The current position in the values array
CtrlPattern.name: index

CtrlPattern.description: The value at the current index of the pattern.
CtrlPattern.name: value

CtrlPattern.description:
The pattern used to select the next
 item from the values array
CtrlPattern.name: type

CtrlRandom.description: If the return value should be an integer
CtrlRandom.name: integer

CtrlRandom.description: Return a random value between min and max.
CtrlRandom.name: value

Master.description: The volume of the master output.
Master.name: volume

AudioNode.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
AudioNode.name: context

Buffer.description: If the buffer is loaded or not
Buffer.name: loaded

Buffer.description: The length of the buffer in samples
Buffer.name: length

Buffer.description:
The number of discrete audio channels. Returns 0 if no buffer
is loaded.
Buffer.name: numberOfChannels

Buffers.description: A path which is prefixed before every url.
Buffers.name: baseUrl

Buffers.description: If the buffers are loaded or not
Buffers.name: loaded

Clock.description: The callback function to invoke at the scheduled tick.
Clock.name: callback

Clock.description: The rate the callback function should be invoked.
Clock.name: frequency

Clock.description:
The number of times the callback was invoked. Starts counting at 0
 and increments after the callback was invoked.
Clock.name: ticks

Clock.description: Returns the playback state of the source, either "started", "stopped" or "paused".
Clock.name: state

Context.description:
How often the Web Worker callback is invoked.
 This number corresponds to how responsive the scheduling
 can be. Context.updateInterval + Context.lookAhead gives you the
 total latency between scheduling an event and hearing it.
Context.name: updateInterval

Context.description:
What the source of the clock is, either "worker" (Web Worker [default]), 
 "timeout" (setTimeout), or "offline" (none).
Context.name: clockSource

Context.description:
The type of playback, which affects tradeoffs between audio 
 output latency and responsiveness. 
 
 In addition to setting the value in seconds, the latencyHint also
 accepts the strings "interactive" (prioritizes low latency), 
 "playback" (prioritizes sustained playback), "balanced" (balances
 latency and performance), and "fastest" (lowest latency, might glitch more often).
Context.name: latencyHint

Delay.description:
The amount of time the incoming signal is
 delayed.
Delay.name: delayTime

Draw.description: The duration after which events are not invoked.
Draw.name: expiration

Draw.description:
The amount of time before the scheduled time 
 that the callback can be invoked. Default is
 half the time of an animation frame (0.008 seconds).
Draw.name: anticipation

Gain.description: The gain parameter of the gain node.
Gain.name: gain

IntervalTimeline.description: The number of items in the timeline.
IntervalTimeline.name: length

Listener.description: The x position of the panner object.
Listener.name: positionX

Listener.description: The y position of the panner object.
Listener.name: positionY

Listener.description: The z position of the panner object.
Listener.name: positionZ

Listener.description:
The x coordinate of the listeners front direction. i.e. 
 which way they are facing.
Listener.name: forwardX

Listener.description:
The y coordinate of the listeners front direction. i.e. 
 which way they are facing.
Listener.name: forwardY

Listener.description:
The z coordinate of the listeners front direction. i.e. 
 which way they are facing.
Listener.name: forwardZ

Listener.description:
The x coordinate of the listener's up direction. i.e.
 the direction the listener is standing in.
Listener.name: upX

Listener.description:
The y coordinate of the listener's up direction. i.e.
 the direction the listener is standing in.
Listener.name: upY

Listener.description:
The z coordinate of the listener's up direction. i.e.
 the direction the listener is standing in.
Listener.name: upZ

Param.description: If the value should be converted or not
Param.name: convert

Param.description: The current value of the parameter.
Param.name: value

Param.description:
The LFO created by the signal instance. If none
 was created, this is null.
Param.name: lfo

Param.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Param.name: context

Timeline.description:
The memory of the timeline, i.e.
 how many events in the past it will retain
Timeline.name: memory

Timeline.description: The number of items in the timeline.
Timeline.name: length

Transport.description: If the transport loops or not.
Transport.name: loop

Transport.description: The Beats Per Minute of the Transport.
Transport.name: bpm

Transport.description: Returns the playback state of the source, either "started", "stopped", or "paused"
Transport.name: state

Transport.description:
The time signature as just the numerator over 4.
 For example 4/4 would be just 4 and 6/8 would be 3.
Transport.name: timeSignature

Transport.description: When the Tone.Transport.loop = true, this is the starting position of the loop.
Transport.name: loopStart

Transport.description: When the Tone.Transport.loop = true, this is the ending position of the loop.
Transport.name: loopEnd

Transport.description:
The swing value. Between 0-1 where 1 equal to
 the note + half the subdivision.
Transport.name: swing

Transport.description:
Set the subdivision which the swing will be applied to.
 The default value is an 8th note. Value must be less
 than a quarter note.
Transport.name: swingSubdivision

Transport.description:
The Transport's position in Bars:Beats:Sixteenths.
 Setting the value will jump to that position right away.
Transport.name: position

Transport.description:
The Transport's position in seconds
 Setting the value will jump to that position right away.
Transport.name: seconds

Transport.description:
The Transport's loop position as a normalized value. Always
 returns 0 if the transport if loop is not true.
Transport.name: progress

Transport.description:
Pulses Per Quarter note. This is the smallest resolution
 the Transport timing supports. This should be set once
 on initialization and not set again. Changing this value
 after other objects have been created can cause problems.
Transport.name: PPQ

TransportEvent.description: Reference to the Transport that created it
TransportEvent.name: Transport

TransportEvent.description: The unique id of the event
TransportEvent.name: id

AutoFilter.description:
The range of the filter modulating between the min and max frequency. 
0 = no modulation. 1 = full modulation.
AutoFilter.name: depth

AutoFilter.description: How fast the filter modulates between min and max.
AutoFilter.name: frequency

AutoFilter.description:
Type of oscillator attached to the AutoFilter. 
Possible values: "sine", "square", "triangle", "sawtooth".
AutoFilter.name: type

AutoFilter.description: The minimum value of the filter's cutoff frequency.
AutoFilter.name: min

AutoFilter.description: The maximum value of the filter's cutoff frequency.
AutoFilter.name: octaves

AutoFilter.description:
Type of oscillator attached to the AutoFilter. 
Possible values: "sine", "square", "triangle", "sawtooth".
AutoFilter.name: type

AutoFilter.description:
The wet control is how much of the effected
 will pass through to the output. 1 = 100% effected
 signal, 0 = 100% dry signal.
AutoFilter.name: wet

AutoFilter.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
AutoFilter.name: context

Effect.description:
The wet control is how much of the effected
 will pass through to the output. 1 = 100% effected
 signal, 0 = 100% dry signal.
Effect.name: wet

Effect.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Effect.name: context

FeedbackEffect.description: The amount of signal which is fed back into the effect input.
FeedbackEffect.name: feedback

The wet control is how much of the effected
 will pass through to the output. 1 = 100% effected
 signal, 0 = 100% dry signal.

FeedbackEffect.name: context

The amount of panning between left and right. 
0 = always center. 1 = full range between left and right.
AutoPanner.name: depth

AutoPanner.description: How fast the panner modulates between left and right.
AutoPanner.name: frequency

AutoPanner.description:
The wet control is how much of the effected
 will pass through to the output. 1 = 100% effected
 signal, 0 = 100% dry signal.
AutoPanner.name: wet

AutoPanner.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
AutoPanner.name: context

The number of octaves that the filter will sweep above the 
baseFrequency.
AutoWah.name: octaves

AutoWah.name: baseFrequency

AutoWah.description: The sensitivity to control how responsive to the input signal the filter is.
AutoWah.name: sensitivity

AutoWah.description:
The wet control is how much of the effected
 will pass through to the output. 1 = 100% effected
 signal, 0 = 100% dry signal.
AutoWah.name: wet

AutoWah.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
AutoWah.name: context

BitCrusher.description: The bit depth of the effect. Nominal range of 1-8.
BitCrusher.name: bits

BitCrusher.description:
The wet control is how much of the effected
 will pass through to the output. 1 = 100% effected
 signal, 0 = 100% dry signal.
BitCrusher.name: wet

BitCrusher.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
BitCrusher.name: context

Chebyshev.description:
The order of the Chebyshev polynomial which creates the equation which is applied to the incoming signal through a Tone.WaveShaper. The equations are in the form:
order 2: 2x^2 + 1
order 3: 4x^3 + 3x
Chebyshev.name: order

Chebyshev.description: The oversampling of the effect. Can either be "none", "2x" or "4x".
Chebyshev.name: oversample

Chebyshev.description:
The wet control is how much of the effected
 will pass through to the output. 1 = 100% effected
 signal, 0 = 100% dry signal.
Chebyshev.name: wet

Chebyshev.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Chebyshev.name: context

Chorus.description: The frequency of the LFO which modulates the delayTime.
Chorus.name: frequency

Chorus.description:
The depth of the effect. A depth of 1 makes the delayTime
modulate between 0 and 2*delayTime (centered around the delayTime).
Chorus.name: depth

Chorus.description:
The delayTime in milliseconds of the chorus. A larger delayTime
will give a more pronounced effect. Nominal range a delayTime
is between 2 and 20ms.
Chorus.name: delayTime

Chorus.description: The oscillator type of the LFO.
Chorus.name: type

Chorus.description:
Amount of stereo spread. When set to 0, both LFO's will be panned centrally.
When set to 180, LFO's will be panned hard left and right respectively.
Chorus.name: spread

Chorus.description:
The amount of feedback from the output
 back into the input of the effect (routed
 across left and right channels).
Chorus.name: feedback

Chorus.description:
The wet control, i.e. how much of the effected
 will pass through to the output.
Chorus.name: wet

Chorus.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Chorus.name: context

Convolver.description:
The wet control is how much of the effected
 will pass through to the output. 1 = 100% effected
 signal, 0 = 100% dry signal.
Convolver.name: wet

Convolver.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Convolver.name: context

Distortion.description: The oversampling of the effect. Can either be "none", "2x" or "4x".
Distortion.name: oversample

Distortion.description:
The wet control is how much of the effected
 will pass through to the output. 1 = 100% effected
 signal, 0 = 100% dry signal.

Distortion.name: context

FeedbackDelay.description: The amount of signal which is fed back into the effect input.
FeedbackDelay.name: feedback

FeedbackDelay.description:
The wet control is how much of the effected
 will pass through to the output. 1 = 100% effected
 signal, 0 = 100% dry signal.
FeedbackDelay.name: wet

FeedbackDelay.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
FeedbackDelay.name: context

The roomSize value between. A larger roomSize
 will result in a longer decay.
Freeverb.name: roomSize

Freeverb.description: The amount of dampening of the reverberant signal.
Freeverb.name: dampening

Freeverb.description:
The wet control is how much of the effected
 will pass through to the output. 1 = 100% effected
 signal, 0 = 100% dry signal.

The wet control is how much of the effected

 signal, 0 = 100% dry signal.

JCReverb.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
JCReverb.name: context

Phaser.description:
The number of octaves the phase goes above
the baseFrequency

Phaser.name: baseFrequency

The wet control, i.e. how much of the effected

PingPongDelay.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
PingPongDelay.name: context

PitchShift.description: The amount of delay on the input signal
PitchShift.name: delayTime

PitchShift.description:
Repitch the incoming signal by some interval (measured
in semi-tones).
examples:
pitchShift.pitch = -12; //down one octave
pitchShift.pitch = 7; //up a fifth
PitchShift.name: pitch

PitchShift.description:
The window size corresponds roughly to the sample length in a looping sampler. 
Smaller values are desirable for a less noticeable delay time of the pitch shifted
signal, but larger values will result in smoother pitch shifting for larger intervals. 
A nominal range of 0.03 to 0.1 is recommended.
PitchShift.name: windowSize

PitchShift.description: The amount of signal which is fed back into the effect input.
PitchShift.name: feedback

PitchShift.description:
The wet control is how much of the effected
 will pass through to the output. 1 = 100% effected
 signal, 0 = 100% dry signal.
PitchShift.name: wet

PitchShift.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
PitchShift.name: context

StereoEffect.description:
The wet control, i.e. how much of the effected
 will pass through to the output.
StereoEffect.name: wet

StereoEffect.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
StereoEffect.name: context

StereoFeedbackEffect.description:
The wet control, i.e. how much of the effected
 will pass through to the output.
StereoFeedbackEffect.name: wet

StereoFeedbackEffect.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
StereoFeedbackEffect.name: context

StereoWidener.description: The width control. 0 = 100% mid. 1 = 100% side. 0.5 = no change.
StereoWidener.name: width

StereoWidener.description:
The wet control is how much of the effected
 will pass through to the output. 1 = 100% effected
 signal, 0 = 100% dry signal.
StereoWidener.name: wet

StereoWidener.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
StereoWidener.name: context

StereoXFeedbackEffect.description:
The amount of feedback from the output
 back into the input of the effect (routed
 across left and right channels).
StereoXFeedbackEffect.name: feedback

StereoXFeedbackEffect.description:
The wet control, i.e. how much of the effected
 will pass through to the output.
StereoXFeedbackEffect.name: wet

StereoXFeedbackEffect.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
StereoXFeedbackEffect.name: context

Tremolo.description:
The depth of the effect. A depth of 0, has no effect
 on the amplitude, and a depth of 1 makes the amplitude
 modulate fully between 0 and 1.
Tremolo.name: depth

Tremolo.description:
Amount of stereo spread. When set to 0, both LFO's will be panned centrally.
When set to 180, LFO's will be panned hard left and right respectively.
Tremolo.name: spread

Tremolo.description:
The wet control, i.e. how much of the effected
 will pass through to the output.
Tremolo.name: wet

Tremolo.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Tremolo.name: context

Vibrato.description: Type of oscillator attached to the Vibrato.
Vibrato.name: type

Vibrato.description:
The wet control is how much of the effected
 will pass through to the output. 1 = 100% effected
 signal, 0 = 100% dry signal.
Vibrato.name: wet

Vibrato.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Vibrato.name: context

Event.description:
If mute is true, the callback won't be
 invoked.
Event.name: mute

Event.description: Returns the playback state of the note, either "started" or "stopped".
Event.name: state

Event.description: The probability of the notes being triggered.
Event.name: probability

Event.description:
If the note should loop or not
 between Tone.Event.loopStart and 
 Tone.Event.loopEnd. An integer
 value corresponds to the number of
 loops the Event does after it starts.
Event.name: loop

Event.description: The playback rate of the note. Defaults to 1.
Event.name: playbackRate

Event.description:
The loopEnd point is the time the event will loop
 if Tone.Event.loop is true.
Event.name: loopEnd

Event.description: The time when the loop should start.
Event.name: loopStart

Event.description:
The current progress of the loop interval.
 Returns 0 if the event is not started yet or
 it is not set to loop.
Event.name: progress

Loop.description: The callback to invoke with the next event in the pattern
Loop.name: callback

Loop.description: The state of the Loop, either started or stopped.
Loop.name: state

Loop.description:
The progress of the loop as a value between 0-1. 0, when
 the loop is stopped or done iterating.
Loop.name: progress

Loop.description:
The playback rate of the loop. The normal playback rate is 1 (no change). 
 A `playbackRate` of 2 would be twice as fast.
Loop.name: playbackRate

Loop.description:
Random variation +/-0.01s to the scheduled time. 
 Or give it a time value which it will randomize by.
Loop.name: humanize

Loop.description: The probably of the callback being invoked.
Loop.name: probability

Loop.description: Muting the Loop means that no callbacks are invoked.
Loop.name: mute

Loop.description:
The number of iterations of the loop. The default
 value is Infinity (loop forever).
Loop.name: iterations

Part.description: The probability of the notes being triggered.
Part.name: probability

Part.description:
If the part should loop or not
 between Tone.Part.loopStart and 
 Tone.Part.loopEnd. An integer
 value corresponds to the number of
 loops the Part does after it starts.
Part.name: loop

Part.description:
The loopEnd point determines when it will 
 loop if Tone.Part.loop is true.
Part.name: loopEnd

Part.description:
The loopStart point determines when it will 
 loop if Tone.Part.loop is true.
Part.name: loopStart

Part.description: The playback rate of the part
Part.name: playbackRate

Part.description: The number of scheduled notes in the part.
Part.name: length

Part.description:
If mute is true, the callback won't be
 invoked.
Part.name: mute

Part.description: Returns the playback state of the note, either "started" or "stopped".
Part.name: state

Part.description:
The current progress of the loop interval.
 Returns 0 if the event is not started yet or
 it is not set to loop.
Part.name: progress

Pattern.description: The current index in the values array.
Pattern.name: index

Pattern.description: The current value of the pattern.
Pattern.name: value

Pattern.description: The pattern type. See Tone.CtrlPattern for the full list of patterns.
Pattern.name: pattern

Pattern.description: The callback to invoke with the next event in the pattern
Pattern.name: callback

Pattern.description: The state of the Loop, either started or stopped.
Pattern.name: state

Pattern.description:
The progress of the loop as a value between 0-1. 0, when
 the loop is stopped or done iterating.
Pattern.name: progress

Pattern.description:
The playback rate of the loop. The normal playback rate is 1 (no change). 
 A `playbackRate` of 2 would be twice as fast.
Pattern.name: playbackRate

Pattern.description:
Random variation +/-0.01s to the scheduled time. 
 Or give it a time value which it will randomize by.
Pattern.name: humanize

Pattern.description: The probably of the callback being invoked.
Pattern.name: probability

Pattern.description: Muting the Loop means that no callbacks are invoked.
Pattern.name: mute

Pattern.description:
The number of iterations of the loop. The default
 value is Infinity (loop forever).
Pattern.name: iterations

Sequence.description:
The subdivision of the sequence. This can only be 
 set in the constructor. The subdivision is the 
 interval between successive steps.
Sequence.name: subdivision

Sequence.description: The probability of the notes being triggered.
Sequence.name: probability

Sequence.description:
If the part should loop or not
 between Tone.Part.loopStart and 
 Tone.Part.loopEnd. An integer
 value corresponds to the number of
 loops the Part does after it starts.
Sequence.name: loop

Sequence.description:
The loopEnd point determines when it will 
 loop if Tone.Part.loop is true.
Sequence.name: loopEnd

Sequence.description:
The loopStart point determines when it will 
 loop if Tone.Part.loop is true.
Sequence.name: loopStart

Sequence.description: The playback rate of the part
Sequence.name: playbackRate

Sequence.description: The number of scheduled notes in the part.
Sequence.name: length

Sequence.description:
If mute is true, the callback won't be
 invoked.
Sequence.name: mute

Sequence.description: Returns the playback state of the note, either "started" or "stopped".
Sequence.name: state

Sequence.description:
The current progress of the loop interval.
 Returns 0 if the event is not started yet or
 it is not set to loop.
Sequence.name: progress

Instrument.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
Instrument.name: volume

Instrument.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Instrument.name: context

AMSynth.description:
The modulator's oscillator which is applied
 to the amplitude of the oscillator
AMSynth.name: modulation

AMSynth.description:
Harmonicity is the ratio between the two voices. A harmonicity of
 1 is no change. Harmonicity = 2 means a change of an octave.
examples:
//pitch voice1 an octave below voice0
synth.harmonicity.value = 0.5;
AMSynth.name: harmonicity

AMSynth.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
AMSynth.name: volume

AMSynth.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
AMSynth.name: context

DuoSynth.description:
Harmonicity is the ratio between the two voices. A harmonicity of
 1 is no change. Harmonicity = 2 means a change of an octave.
examples:
//pitch voice1 an octave below voice0
duoSynth.harmonicity.value = 0.5;
DuoSynth.name: harmonicity

DuoSynth.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
DuoSynth.name: volume

DuoSynth.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
DuoSynth.name: context

FMSynth.description:
The modulator's oscillator which is applied
 to the amplitude of the oscillator
FMSynth.name: modulation

FMSynth.description:
Harmonicity is the ratio between the two voices. A harmonicity of
 1 is no change. Harmonicity = 2 means a change of an octave.
examples:
//pitch voice1 an octave below voice0
synth.harmonicity.value = 0.5;
FMSynth.name: harmonicity

FMSynth.description:
The modulation index which essentially the depth or amount of the modulation. It is the
 ratio of the frequency of the modulating signal (mf) to the amplitude of the
 modulating signal (ma) -- as in ma/mf.
FMSynth.name: modulationIndex

FMSynth.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
FMSynth.name: volume

FMSynth.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
FMSynth.name: context

MembraneSynth.description: The number of octaves the pitch envelope ramps.
MembraneSynth.name: octaves

MembraneSynth.description: The amount of time the frequency envelope takes.
MembraneSynth.name: pitchDecay

MembraneSynth.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
MembraneSynth.name: volume

MembraneSynth.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
MembraneSynth.name: context

MetalSynth.description:
The envelope which is connected both to the
 amplitude and highpass filter's cutoff frequency
MetalSynth.name: envelope

MetalSynth.description:
The modulationIndex of the oscillators which make up the source.
 see Tone.FMOscillator.modulationIndex
MetalSynth.name: modulationIndex

MetalSynth.description:
The harmonicity of the oscillators which make up the source.
 see Tone.FMOscillator.harmonicity
MetalSynth.name: harmonicity

MetalSynth.description: The frequency of the highpass filter attached to the envelope
MetalSynth.name: resonance

MetalSynth.description:
The number of octaves above the "resonance" frequency
 that the filter ramps during the attack/decay envelope
MetalSynth.name: octaves

MetalSynth.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
MetalSynth.name: volume

MetalSynth.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
MetalSynth.name: context

MonoSynth.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
MonoSynth.name: volume

MonoSynth.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
MonoSynth.name: context

Monophonic.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
Monophonic.name: volume

Monophonic.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Monophonic.name: context

NoiseSynth.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
NoiseSynth.name: volume

NoiseSynth.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
NoiseSynth.name: context

PluckSynth.description:
The amount of noise at the attack. 
 Nominal range of [0.1, 20]
PluckSynth.name: attackNoise

PluckSynth.description: The dampening control. i.e. the lowpass filter frequency of the comb filter
PluckSynth.name: dampening

PluckSynth.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
PluckSynth.name: volume

PluckSynth.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
PluckSynth.name: context

PolySynth.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
PolySynth.name: volume

PolySynth.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
PolySynth.name: context

Sampler.description: The envelope applied to the beginning of the sample.
Sampler.name: attack

Sampler.description: The envelope applied to the end of the envelope.
Sampler.name: release

Sampler.description: If the buffers are loaded or not
Sampler.name: loaded

Sampler.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
Sampler.name: volume

Sampler.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Sampler.name: context

Synth.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
Synth.name: volume

Synth.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Synth.name: context

Expr.description: The inputs. The length is determined by the expression.
Expr.name: input

Expr.description: The output node is the result of the expression
Expr.name: output

Normalize.description: The minimum value the input signal will reach.
Normalize.name: min

Normalize.description: The maximum value the input signal will reach.
Normalize.name: max

Scale.description:
The minimum output value. This number is output when 
the value input value is 0.
Scale.name: min

Scale.description:
The maximum output value. This number is output when 
the value input value is 1.
Scale.name: max

ScaleExp.description: Instead of interpolating linearly between the min and max values, setting the exponent will interpolate between the two values with an exponential curve.
ScaleExp.name: exponent

ScaleExp.description:
The minimum output value. This number is output when 
the value input value is 0.
ScaleExp.name: min

ScaleExp.description:
The maximum output value. This number is output when 
the value input value is 1.
ScaleExp.name: max

TimelineSignal.description: The current value of the signal.
TimelineSignal.name: value

TimelineSignal.description: If the value should be converted or not
TimelineSignal.name: convert

TimelineSignal.description:
The LFO created by the signal instance. If none
 was created, this is null.
TimelineSignal.name: lfo

TimelineSignal.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
TimelineSignal.name: context

WaveShaper.description:
The array to set as the waveshaper curve. For linear curves
array length does not make much difference, but for complex curves
longer arrays will provide smoother interpolation.
WaveShaper.name: curve

WaveShaper.description:
Specifies what type of oversampling (if any) should be used when 
applying the shaping curve. Can either be "none", "2x" or "4x".
WaveShaper.name: oversample

AMOscillator.description:
Harmonicity is the frequency ratio between the carrier and the modulator oscillators. 
 A harmonicity of 1 gives both oscillators the same frequency. 
 Harmonicity = 2 means a change of an octave.
examples:
//pitch the modulator an octave below carrier
synth.harmonicity.value = 0.5;
AMOscillator.name: harmonicity

AMOscillator.description: The type of the carrier oscillator
AMOscillator.name: type

AMOscillator.description: The type of the modulator oscillator
AMOscillator.name: modulationType

AMOscillator.description: The phase of the oscillator in degrees.
AMOscillator.name: phase

AMOscillator.description:
The partials of the carrier waveform. A partial represents 
the amplitude at a harmonic. The first harmonic is the 
fundamental frequency, the second is the octave and so on
following the harmonic series. 
Setting this value will automatically set the type to "custom". 
The value is an empty array when the type is not "custom".
AMOscillator.name: partials

AMOscillator.description: The fadeIn time of the amplitude envelope.
AMOscillator.name: fadeIn

AMOscillator.description: The fadeOut time of the amplitude envelope.
AMOscillator.name: fadeOut

AMOscillator.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
AMOscillator.name: volume

AMOscillator.description: Returns the playback state of the source, either "started" or "stopped".
AMOscillator.name: state

AMOscillator.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
AMOscillator.name: context

BufferSource.description:
The callback to invoke after the
 buffer source is done playing.
BufferSource.name: onended

BufferSource.description: The fadeIn time of the amplitude envelope.
BufferSource.name: fadeIn

BufferSource.description: The fadeOut time of the amplitude envelope.
BufferSource.name: fadeOut

BufferSource.description: The curve applied to the fades, either "linear" or "exponential"
BufferSource.name: curve

BufferSource.description: Returns the playback state of the source, either "started" or "stopped".
BufferSource.name: state

BufferSource.description: If loop is true, the loop will start at this position.
BufferSource.name: loopStart

BufferSource.description: If loop is true, the loop will end at this position.
BufferSource.name: loopEnd

BufferSource.description: The audio buffer belonging to the player.
BufferSource.name: buffer

BufferSource.description: If the buffer should loop once it's over.
BufferSource.name: loop

BufferSource.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
BufferSource.name: context

FMOscillator.description:
The modulation index which is in essence the depth or amount of the modulation. In other terms it is the 
 ratio of the frequency of the modulating signal (mf) to the amplitude of the 
 modulating signal (ma) -- as in ma/mf.
FMOscillator.name: modulationIndex

FMOscillator.description:
Harmonicity is the frequency ratio between the carrier and the modulator oscillators. 
 A harmonicity of 1 gives both oscillators the same frequency. 
 Harmonicity = 2 means a change of an octave.
examples:
//pitch the modulator an octave below carrier
synth.harmonicity.value = 0.5;
FMOscillator.name: harmonicity

FMOscillator.description: The type of the carrier oscillator
FMOscillator.name: type

FMOscillator.description: The type of the modulator oscillator
FMOscillator.name: modulationType

FMOscillator.description: The phase of the oscillator in degrees.
FMOscillator.name: phase

FMOscillator.description:
The partials of the carrier waveform. A partial represents 
the amplitude at a harmonic. The first harmonic is the 
fundamental frequency, the second is the octave and so on
following the harmonic series. 
Setting this value will automatically set the type to "custom". 
The value is an empty array when the type is not "custom".
FMOscillator.name: partials

FMOscillator.description: The fadeIn time of the amplitude envelope.
FMOscillator.name: fadeIn

FMOscillator.description: The fadeOut time of the amplitude envelope.
FMOscillator.name: fadeOut

FMOscillator.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
FMOscillator.name: volume

FMOscillator.description: Returns the playback state of the source, either "started" or "stopped".
FMOscillator.name: state

FMOscillator.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
FMOscillator.name: context

FatOscillator.description: The type of the carrier oscillator
FatOscillator.name: type

FatOscillator.description:
The detune spread between the oscillators. If "count" is
set to 3 oscillators and the "spread" is set to 40,
the three oscillators would be detuned like this: [-20, 0, 20]
for a total detune spread of 40 cents.
FatOscillator.name: spread

FatOscillator.description: The phase of the oscillator in degrees.
FatOscillator.name: phase

FatOscillator.description:
The partials of the carrier waveform. A partial represents 
the amplitude at a harmonic. The first harmonic is the 
fundamental frequency, the second is the octave and so on
following the harmonic series. 
Setting this value will automatically set the type to "custom". 
The value is an empty array when the type is not "custom".
FatOscillator.name: partials

FatOscillator.description: The fadeIn time of the amplitude envelope.
FatOscillator.name: fadeIn

FatOscillator.description: The fadeOut time of the amplitude envelope.
FatOscillator.name: fadeOut

FatOscillator.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
FatOscillator.name: volume

FatOscillator.description: Returns the playback state of the source, either "started" or "stopped".
FatOscillator.name: state

FatOscillator.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
FatOscillator.name: context

GrainPlayer.description: The audio buffer belonging to the player.
GrainPlayer.name: buffer

GrainPlayer.description: Adjust the pitch independently of the playbackRate.
GrainPlayer.name: detune

GrainPlayer.description: The playback rate of the sample
GrainPlayer.name: playbackRate

GrainPlayer.description: The direction the buffer should play in
GrainPlayer.name: reverse

GrainPlayer.description:
The size of each chunk of audio that the
buffer is chopped into and played back at.
GrainPlayer.name: grainSize

GrainPlayer.description:
This is the duration of the cross-fade between
sucessive grains.
GrainPlayer.name: overlap

GrainPlayer.description: The fadeIn time of the amplitude envelope.
GrainPlayer.name: fadeIn

GrainPlayer.description: The fadeOut time of the amplitude envelope.
GrainPlayer.name: fadeOut

GrainPlayer.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
GrainPlayer.name: volume

GrainPlayer.description: Returns the playback state of the source, either "started" or "stopped".
GrainPlayer.name: state

GrainPlayer.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
GrainPlayer.name: context

MultiPlayer.description: All the buffers belonging to the player.
MultiPlayer.name: buffers

MultiPlayer.description:
The fade in envelope which is applied
 to the beginning of the BufferSource
MultiPlayer.name: fadeIn

MultiPlayer.description:
The fade out envelope which is applied
 to the end of the BufferSource
MultiPlayer.name: fadeOut

MultiPlayer.description:
Returns the playback state of the source. "started"
 if there are any buffers playing. "stopped" otherwise.
MultiPlayer.name: state

Noise.description:
The playback rate of the noise. Affects
 the "frequency" of the noise.
Noise.name: _playbackRate

Noise.description: The type of the noise. Can be "white", "brown", or "pink".
Noise.name: type

Noise.description: The fadeIn time of the amplitude envelope.
Noise.name: fadeIn

Noise.description: The fadeOut time of the amplitude envelope.
Noise.name: fadeOut

Noise.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
Noise.name: volume

Noise.description: Returns the playback state of the source, either "started" or "stopped".
Noise.name: state

Noise.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Noise.name: context

OmniOscillator.description:
The type of the oscillator. Can be any of the basic types: sine, square, triangle, sawtooth. Or
prefix the basic types with "fm", "am", or "fat" to use the FMOscillator, AMOscillator or FatOscillator
types. The oscillator could also be set to "pwm" or "pulse". All of the parameters of the
oscillator's class are accessible when the oscillator is set to that type, but throws an error 
when it's not.
OmniOscillator.name: type

OmniOscillator.description:
The partials of the waveform. A partial represents 
the amplitude at a harmonic. The first harmonic is the 
fundamental frequency, the second is the octave and so on
following the harmonic series. 
Setting this value will automatically set the type to "custom". 
The value is an empty array when the type is not "custom". 
This is not available on "pwm" and "pulse" oscillator types.
OmniOscillator.name: partials

OmniOscillator.description: The phase of the oscillator in degrees.
OmniOscillator.name: phase

OmniOscillator.description: The width of the oscillator (only if the oscillator is set to "pulse")
OmniOscillator.name: width

OmniOscillator.description:
The detune spread between the oscillators. If "count" is
set to 3 oscillators and the "spread" is set to 40,
the three oscillators would be detuned like this: [-20, 0, 20]
for a total detune spread of 40 cents. See Tone.FatOscillator
for more info.
OmniOscillator.name: spread

OmniOscillator.description:
The type of the modulator oscillator. Only if the oscillator
is set to "am" or "fm" types. see. Tone.AMOscillator or Tone.FMOscillator
for more info.
OmniOscillator.name: modulationType

OmniOscillator.description:
Harmonicity is the frequency ratio between the carrier and the modulator oscillators. 
 A harmonicity of 1 gives both oscillators the same frequency. 
 Harmonicity = 2 means a change of an octave. See Tone.AMOscillator or Tone.FMOscillator
 for more info.
OmniOscillator.name: harmonicity

OmniOscillator.description:
The modulationFrequency Signal of the oscillator 
(only if the oscillator type is set to pwm). See 
Tone.PWMOscillator for more info.
OmniOscillator.name: modulationFrequency

OmniOscillator.description: The fadeIn time of the amplitude envelope.
OmniOscillator.name: fadeIn

OmniOscillator.description: The fadeOut time of the amplitude envelope.
OmniOscillator.name: fadeOut

OmniOscillator.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
OmniOscillator.name: volume

OmniOscillator.description: Returns the playback state of the source, either "started" or "stopped".
OmniOscillator.name: state

OmniOscillator.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
OmniOscillator.name: context

Oscillator.description:
The type of the oscillator: either sine, square, triangle, or sawtooth. Also capable of setting the first x number of partials of the oscillator. For example: "sine4" would set be the first 4 partials of the sine wave and "triangle8" would set the first 8 partials of the triangle wave.

Uses PeriodicWave internally even for native types so that it can set the phase. PeriodicWave equations are from the [Webkit Web Audio implementation](https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/third_party/WebKit/Source/modules/webaudio/PeriodicWave.cpp&sq=package:chromium).
examples:
//set it to a square wave
osc.type = "square";

//set the first 6 partials of a sawtooth wave
osc.type = "sawtooth6";
Oscillator.name: type

Oscillator.description:
The partials of the waveform. A partial represents
the amplitude at a harmonic. The first harmonic is the
fundamental frequency, the second is the octave and so on
following the harmonic series.
Setting this value will automatically set the type to "custom".
The value is an empty array when the type is not "custom".
Oscillator.name: partials

Oscillator.description: The phase of the oscillator in degrees.
examples: osc.phase = 180; //flips the phase of the oscillator
Oscillator.name: phase

Oscillator.description: The fadeIn time of the amplitude envelope.
Oscillator.name: fadeIn

Oscillator.description: The fadeOut time of the amplitude envelope.
Oscillator.name: fadeOut

Oscillator.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
Oscillator.name: volume

Oscillator.description: Returns the playback state of the source, either "started" or "stopped".
Oscillator.name: state

Oscillator.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Oscillator.name: context

PWMOscillator.description: The modulation rate of the oscillator.
PWMOscillator.name: modulationFrequency

PWMOscillator.description: The type of the oscillator. Always returns "pwm".
PWMOscillator.name: type

PWMOscillator.description: The phase of the oscillator in degrees.
PWMOscillator.name: phase

PWMOscillator.description: The fadeIn time of the amplitude envelope.
PWMOscillator.name: fadeIn

PWMOscillator.description: The fadeOut time of the amplitude envelope.
PWMOscillator.name: fadeOut

PWMOscillator.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
PWMOscillator.name: volume

PWMOscillator.description: Returns the playback state of the source, either "started" or "stopped".
PWMOscillator.name: state

PWMOscillator.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
PWMOscillator.name: context

Player.description:
If the file should play as soon
 as the buffer is loaded.
Player.name: autostart

Player.description:
Enabling retrigger will allow a player to be restarted
 before the the previous 'start' is done playing. Otherwise, 
 successive calls to Tone.Player.start will only start
 the sample if it had played all the way through.
Player.name: retrigger

Player.description: The fadeIn time of the amplitude envelope.
Player.name: fadeIn

Player.description: The fadeOut time of the amplitude envelope.
Player.name: fadeOut

Player.description: If loop is true, the loop will start at this position.
Player.name: loopStart

Player.description: If loop is true, the loop will end at this position.
Player.name: loopEnd

Player.description: The audio buffer belonging to the player.
Player.name: buffer

Player.description: If the buffer should loop once it's over.
Player.name: loop

Player.description:
The playback speed. 1 is normal speed. This is not a signal because
Safari and iOS currently don't support playbackRate as a signal.
Player.name: playbackRate

Player.description: The direction the buffer should play in
Player.name: reverse

Player.description: If all the buffer is loaded
Player.name: loaded

Player.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
Player.name: volume

Player.description: Returns the playback state of the source, either "started" or "stopped".
Player.name: state

Player.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Player.name: context

Players.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
Players.name: volume

Players.description: The state of the players object. Returns "started" if any of the players are playing.
Players.name: state

Players.description: If all the buffers are loaded or not
Players.name: loaded

Players.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Players.name: context

Source.description: The fadeIn time of the amplitude envelope.
Source.name: fadeIn

Source.description: The fadeOut time of the amplitude envelope.
Source.name: fadeOut

Source.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
Source.name: volume

Source.description: Returns the playback state of the source, either "started" or "stopped".
Source.name: state

Source.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Source.name: context

PulseOscillator.description: The phase of the oscillator in degrees.
PulseOscillator.name: phase

PulseOscillator.description: The type of the oscillator. Always returns "pulse".
PulseOscillator.name: type

PulseOscillator.description: The fadeIn time of the amplitude envelope.
PulseOscillator.name: fadeIn

PulseOscillator.description: The fadeOut time of the amplitude envelope.
PulseOscillator.name: fadeOut

PulseOscillator.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
PulseOscillator.name: volume

PulseOscillator.description: Returns the playback state of the source, either "started" or "stopped".
PulseOscillator.name: state

PulseOscillator.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
PulseOscillator.name: context

UserMedia.description: The volume of the output in decibels.
UserMedia.name: volume

UserMedia.description:
Returns the playback state of the source, "started" when the microphone is open
 and "stopped" when the mic is closed.
UserMedia.name: state

UserMedia.description:
Returns an identifier for the represented device that is
	persisted across sessions. It is un-guessable by other applications and
	unique to the origin of the calling application. It is reset when the
	user clears cookies (for Private Browsing, a different identifier is
	used that is not persisted across sessions). Returns undefined when the
	device is not open.
UserMedia.name: deviceId

UserMedia.description:
Returns a group identifier. Two devices have the
	same group identifier if they belong to the same physical device.
	Returns undefined when the device is not open.
UserMedia.name: groupId

UserMedia.description:
Returns a label describing this device (for example "Built-in Microphone").
	Returns undefined when the device is not open or label is not available
	because of permissions.
UserMedia.name: groupId

UserMedia.description: If getUserMedia is supported by the browser.
UserMedia.name: supported

UserMedia.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
UserMedia.name: context

AmplitudeEnvelope.description:
When triggerAttack is called, the attack time is the amount of
 time it takes for the envelope to reach it's maximum value.
AmplitudeEnvelope.name: attack

AmplitudeEnvelope.description:
After the attack portion of the envelope, the value will fall
 over the duration of the decay time to it's sustain value.
AmplitudeEnvelope.name: decay

AmplitudeEnvelope.description:
The sustain value is the value
	which the envelope rests at after triggerAttack is
	called, but before triggerRelease is invoked.
AmplitudeEnvelope.name: sustain

AmplitudeEnvelope.description:
After triggerRelease is called, the envelope's
 value will fall to it's miminum value over the
 duration of the release time.
AmplitudeEnvelope.name: release

AmplitudeEnvelope.description:
Read the current value of the envelope. Useful for
syncronizing visual output to the envelope.
AmplitudeEnvelope.name: value

AmplitudeEnvelope.description:
The shape of the attack. Can be any of these strings:
  • linear
  • exponential
  • sine
  • cosine
  • bounce
  • ripple
  • step
Can also be an array which describes the curve. Values in the array are evenly subdivided and linearly interpolated over the duration of the attack.
AmplitudeEnvelope.name: attackCurve

AmplitudeEnvelope.description: The shape of the release. See the attack curve types.
AmplitudeEnvelope.name: releaseCurve

AmplitudeEnvelope.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
AmplitudeEnvelope.name: context

Mono.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
Mono.name: context

OfflineContext.description:
How often the Web Worker callback is invoked.
 This number corresponds to how responsive the scheduling
 can be. Context.updateInterval + Context.lookAhead gives you the
 total latency between scheduling an event and hearing it.
OfflineContext.name: updateInterval

OfflineContext.description:
What the source of the clock is, either "worker" (Web Worker [default]), 
 "timeout" (setTimeout), or "offline" (none).
OfflineContext.name: clockSource

OfflineContext.description:
The type of playback, which affects tradeoffs between audio 
 output latency and responsiveness. 
 
 In addition to setting the value in seconds, the latencyHint also
 accepts the strings "interactive" (prioritizes low latency), 
 "playback" (prioritizes sustained playback), "balanced" (balances
 latency and performance), and "fastest" (lowest latency, might glitch more often).
OfflineContext.name: latencyHint

TimelineState.description:
The memory of the timeline, i.e.
 how many events in the past it will retain
TimelineState.name: memory

TimelineState.description: The number of items in the timeline.
TimelineState.name: length

TransportRepeatEvent.description: Reference to the Transport that created it
TransportRepeatEvent.name: Transport

TransportRepeatEvent.description: The unique id of the event
TransportRepeatEvent.name: id

MidSideEffect.description:
The wet control is how much of the effected
 will pass through to the output. 1 = 100% effected
 signal, 0 = 100% dry signal.
MidSideEffect.name: wet

MidSideEffect.description: Get the audio context belonging to this instance.
MidSideEffect.name: context
